responses: Hi there, how can I help?

patterns: i got a cut in my hand what can i do
there is a small scratch in my leg what should i do
my friend got a cut in his toe
i got a wound in my right hand
i got a wound near my left hand
responses:
prevent as much blood from leaving from your body,apply gentle pressure for 20 min,
clean the wound by gently running clean water running over it
if it's a deep wound seek medical attention ASAP..

if it's a small wound clean the wound with pure water ,apply antibiotic to the wound
if it's a deep wound seek medical profesionals !!!! ASAP !!!.
clean with the normal pure water and aviod using soap on a open wound ,apply Neoporin and take some rest.

patterns: i got an ankle sprain what can i do
my joint dislocated while running what can i do
my leg is swelled what should i do
there is a repeated sprain in my joint
i have an ankle sprain what can i do for that
there is swelling in my leg
responses: keep the injured limb elevated,apply some ice with cloth covered to it to the injured area!
keep the swelled area compressed .put it in a brace or tightly wrap and apply some ice to the sprained area!!
keep the ice swelled area for a while !!,and avoid putting weight on the injured area.

patterns: i am having a weak pulse
my head is paining a lot
responses: so get the person to a shaded area,give him/her a water and keep them hydrated.
keep the person coverd by the sunlight and give some water !!
place the cool cloth on their forehead to lower their temperature and give some water.
intents.context_set: this is caused to due to prolonged exposure of high temperature

patterns: i am getting cold and my body is shivering
my friend lost his consciousness  because of low temperature what can i do
my body temperature is decreasing a lot due to cold temperature ..
i am feeling cold and shivering
responses:
don't rub their body and don't move their body in too jarring of a way;this could trigger cardiac arrest
move the person out of the cold,and remove any wet clothes,cover the person with blankets to keep them warm.

move the person out of the cold and use heat packs to keep them warm.
give the person warm fluids.
